resources.string: Welcome To Our app\n \n Uncover Korea, the land of captivating stories and flavorful cuisine
Just steps from Gwanghwamun Plaza, Four Seasons Hotel Seoul boasts commanding city views and features 5 in-house dining, a state-of-the art fitness facilities.
The Escape Hotel is located in Seoul and offers a fitness center and a bar. The front desk is open 24/7. Guests can also enjoy a restaurant on-site. Free Wi-Fi is provided.
The RYSE, Autograph Collection Seoul is a hotel in the lively Hongdae area, near Hongik University subway station (Exit 9, with multiple lines). It offers free Wi-Fi and valet parking.

The Signiel Seoul, a 5-star hotel high in the Lotte World Tower, offers panoramic city views, fine dining, an indoor pool, and a gym. Its directly connected to the Jamsil subway station and provides free Wi-Fi.
luxurious 5-star hotel, blending French elegance with Korean hospitality near key attractions like Lotte World. It offers sophisticated rooms, diverse dining options, and excellent facilities
Daol Charcoal Grill Myeongdong Branch is a restaurant where you can taste representative K-food foods such as bulgogi, soybean paste stew and fresh food .
Indulge in delicious global cuisine in a dynamic and stylish atmosphere while dining at Flavors. Our restaurant is located in the JW Marriott Hotel Soul and serves breakfast, lunch and dinner daily
176 Sinbanpo-ro, Seocho-gu Séoul, Corée du Sud

Located in the busiest area in Myeongdong, it provides a variety of menus includint most popular Korean food such as Galbi(beef), Samgyupsal(pork), Yukhoe(raw beef), Naengmyeon(cold noodle) and tteokbokki.
2F, 28 Myeongdong 8na-gil, Jung District, Seoul, Corée du Sud

Korean restaurants that specialize in soup with bean sprouts Vegetarian food and specialized in the food and naturalism. Using only pure ingredients that provide healthy fofood. Friendly staff and reasonable prices is a good thing.

Samcheong-dong is famous for its Bukchon Hanok (Korean traditional houses) Village, surrounded by both Gyeongbokgung Palace and Changdeokgung Palace Many tourists come here to rent traditional Korean costume of Hanbok, walking around taking #OOTDs. It’s quite amusing to watch, really. Maybe one day I will get enough courage to do that

There are several entrances. One popular route is to pass the overpass next to Hotel Hyatt in Itaewon. Local bus #3 reaches here.

Lots of flowers. There are well-maintained pine forest, bamboo forest, pavilions, ponds, stream, benches, little outdoor gyms, observation deck, kids' park, flower garden, etc.

- It's possible to climb up the mountain through this garden.

A must do if you’re in Seoul but you have to walk it!! It only takes 45 minutes (one way) and it’s not too steep. As you get higher and higher, you’ll be stunned with amazing views of the city and beautiful autumn trees. Head for the cable car entrance and turn right, there’s a big brick wall called the Seoul city limit which you can follow all the way up to the top of the mountain and to the tower. A really nice way to spend a couple of hours as the afternoon turns into the evening
This park has it all: rides, a zoo, a park, and a concert hall. Make sure to check out the most popular event: a dazzling water-fountain music and lights show.
This is a nice park for neighbors. Not recommended to visit for tourists because the location is quite suburb of the city. -there are water showers for kids, sports courts, etc..
This is a garden on the rooftop of Seoul Station. It has some interesting decoration. Good to take a look for minutes..
Best for a natural escape: Hwagyesa
Hwagyesa Temple offers a natural escape in Seoul, surrounded by lush greenery and peaceful trails, providing a serene retreat from the city.
Bongwonsa Temple embodies ancient Korean Buddhist traditions through its historic rituals. It offers visitors an authentic glimpse into the heart of this cultural heritage.

Jogyesa Temple is the chief temple of the Jogye Order of Korean Buddhism, located in the heart of Seoul. Its vibrant and intricately decorated main hall, Daeungjeon, houses several important Buddhist statues and artifacts. The temple serves as a central hub for Buddhist practices, ceremonies, and cultural events, offering a serene and spiritual escape amidst the bustling city. Its ancient trees and peaceful courtyards provide a tranquil atmosphere for visitors seeking contemplation and a glimpse into Korean Buddhist traditions.
Bongeunsa Temple, in Seouls Gangnam,is a peaceful evening retreat. Its serene atmosphere, softly lit by lanterns, offers a tranquil escape for quiet reflection and solitude.

Myeong-dong Cathedral is a historic and architecturally impressive Gothic Revival church in central Seoul, a significant symbol of Korean Catholicism. Built in 1898, it has played a key role in the nations history and offers a peaceful respite in the vibrant Myeong-dong area.
